Saw Harry Potter and the Half Blood Prince and it was no disappointment for HP fans. Lots of fun. I won't spoil anything for those who didn't read the book, will just mention that the musical score was unusually good this time around, and shots of Harry's feet get you wanting to run out and buy a pair of Converse sneakers.

post_info.post_title: Harry Potter and the Half Blood Prince

fans are forgiving, unbiased critics are not.
 
 There are no sex scenes not even a chaste kiss. It is sombre, dark movie. No fun at all.
Half-blood sounds like a racial slur.

Try reading the books for a little context, Ethmi.
 
 I liked the film. It didn't include enough of the little details that make the books a good read, but there wasn't the time, even in a three-hour monster such as this. The acting had improved enough from the early films that several of the scenes came across perfectly.

I have read all the books in the Harry Potter series but i have only seen the first 2 films.
 What are the 4 i havent seen like??
 Are they worth watching?
